meanings.definition: To make morally corrupt or wicked.
meanings.sent1: Watching violent movies can deprave young minds.
meanings.sent2: The criminal's actions deprave society as a whole.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to deprave the dog into stealing treats.
meanings.sent4: The dark influence of the city began to deprave her innocent soul.
meanings.sent5: The sinister character in the story sought to deprave the hero's sense of justice.

meanings.definition: To lead someone into a morally corrupt or wicked way of life.
meanings.sent1: Peer pressure can deprave teenagers into making bad choices.
meanings.sent2: The cult leader sought to deprave his followers with false promises.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to deprave the dog into joining its nighttime adventures.
meanings.sent4: The allure of power can deprave even the most virtuous individuals.
meanings.sent5: The corrupt politician's greed began to deprave the once honest community.
